title: Drawing, "Project for a Ceiling Fresco: Leda and the Swan", ca. 1775
medium: Brush and grey wash, pen and  brown ink, graphite on paper
markings: watermark:  Crown above three circles with S below.  D in center
signed: Signed in pen and grey ink, center: Mergolo.
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Circular borderline.  Leda upon clouds, recumbent, the swan beside her.  Amor is aiming at her.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a Ceiling Fresco: Leda and the Swan", ca. 1775.
ca. 1775. Brush and grey wash, pen and  brown ink, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4381.
